I worked for a Theatre group in the 70's, and the answer then is no. Most theatres had one screen. They used arc projectors with positive and negative electrodes burning to make the light. That's why film would burn up if the projector jammed. They use lots of electricity. The projectors each had their own chimneys to vent the heat. Projection rooms were always hot. When we'd get only a few people for a film, the manager would apologize and refund their money. Just not cost effective.
